availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William D. Pope (Bracken County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier)

body.p: Bracken County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to America Pope. Father of John B. Pope, Nannie S. Pope, and Mary E. Pope. Farm laborer in Bracken County in 1860. Private in the 8th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (Confederate) in November 1862.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Eastern District, p. 109. Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0046.
